Stream your Mac or iOS screen directly to your Android device using AirPlay
Just select your device from Screen Mirroring on your Apple device
Make sure both devices are on the same WiFi network, then tap Get Started
AirPlay is Apple\'s wireless streaming protocol that allows you to mirror your Mac or iOS device screen to compatible receivers. Pentagram turns your Android device into an AirPlay receiver.

1. Ensure both devices are on the same WiFi network
2. Start the AirPlay service in Pentagram
3. On your Mac: Click Control Center → Screen Mirroring → Select "⛧ [Device Name]"
4. On iOS: Open Control Center → Screen Mirroring → Select your device
5. If prompted, enter the PIN shown on your Android device

• Device not appearing: Make sure both devices are on the same WiFi network
• Connection fails: Try restarting the AirPlay service
• Black screen: Wait a few seconds for the stream to initialize
• Lag or stuttering: Move closer to your WiFi router
• Video only - audio streaming is not yet supported\n• Requires same WiFi network (no Bluetooth or direct connection)\n• Screen orientation locks when streaming begins
